title: Castle Galleries to celebrate anniversary
text:
Castle Galleries, with a branch on Victoria Street, Wolverhampton, has hosted artists such as Bob Dylan, Ronnie Wood and Stuart McAlpine Miller – as well as promoting local artists such as Keith Maiden – throughout its 20-year history. More on this story Wolverhampton fireworks tickets on sale 
The Castle Galleries franchise started in 1995 from a single outlet in Stratford-upon-Avon. 
To mark the 20th anniversary, managing director Ian Weatherby-Blythe will appear at the Wolverhampton branch as part of his challenge to visit Castle’s 34 galleries in just six days, travelling more than 1,500 miles to three countries and 20 English counties. What do you think? Be the first to comment 
There will also be special offers on limited edition prints this weekend. 
Ian Collunbell, Wolverhampton gallery manager, said:“Castle Galleries enjoyed strong sales last year – something we hope to continue in anniversary year.” For more information on events in and around Wolverhampton, click here Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
